intro: Aeschynanthus crassifolius, commonly known as the wax plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Gesneriaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly Tanzania and Kenya. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value. Aeschynanthus crassifolius requires well-draining soil and consistent moisture to flourish.
